thread.title: Jimmy Fallon skewers GOP lawmakers ducking town halls
thread.title_full: Jimmy Fallon skewers GOP lawmakers ducking town halls

title: Jimmy Fallon skewers GOP lawmakers ducking town halls
text:
Email Andrew Lipovsky/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images 
As Republican lawmakers find themselves facing angry crowds at town hall-style meetings across the country, Jimmy Fallon is lampooning those who try to take the easy way out by bailing on their constituents . 
In an excerpt from Wednesday’s episode of The Tonight Show , Fallon presents a mock C-SPAN lineup of politicians desperate to avoid irate citizens. At noon, for example, “Senator Mitch McConnell zips himself into a duffel bag and asks his assistant to carry him out to the parking lot.” 
At 2 p.m., “House Speaker Paul Ryan says, ‘I have to take this call,’ then starts talking into a stapler.” 
And an hour later, “Senator Rand Paul shouts, ‘Is that Nick from The Bachelor ?!’ then tries to run through the wall like the Kool-Aid Man.” #FallonTonight Sneak Peek: Hostile crowds at GOP Town Halls are really affecting today's C-SPAN TV line-up pic.twitter.com/zFPt3ZXTUS 
— Fallon Tonight (@FallonTonight) February 23, 2017 
The Tonight Show airs weeknights at 11:35 p.m. ET on NBC. Watch the clip above. Show Full Article
